data.title: Excellent breakfasts on a rotating menu!
data.text:
We've been here several times as we live right next to Olde Town Arvada and have not been disappointed at all! Excellent meals on a menu that's rarely the same thing twice. 

Actually, my only complaint would be that the $6 mimosas are too small...but oh well.

data.title: Great breakfast! The pumpkin pancakes are amazing!
data.text: We had a wonderful breakfast - everything was delicious and our service was great. The pumpkin pancakes and lattes were the highlight. I will definitely be returning for those again and also to try the crepes. I highly recommend.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: We have been going here every Sunday since moving to the Golden area. We used to go here years ago and have noticed since coming back that the over standard has degraded. Cleanliness is below par, the outdoor areas need steam cleaned and the wait staff attire is really grungy. We went today and sat outside. We were the first ones seated outdoors with several tables seated after us. We sat for 10 min without ever being acknowledged so we left. We told them before we left what had happened and they were clueless. We left and went to Steubens down the road and wow what a difference. We found our new Sunday place!!!! Eggshell you lost a customer!

data.title: Noisey as heck
data.text: Wow forget this place if you want a quiet meal.  Food was not bad but nothing special.  The noise factor drops the rating a bunch!!!

data.title: Great location
data.text: LOVE Olde Town Arvada!  Our normal breakfast place was closed so we stopped here.  Coffee was good, servings were adequate, service was average, flavor of the corned beef was different - corned beef had been put through a grinder and was VERY small pieces w/little seasoning except salt.  The meal defined average not eggceptional!

data.title: Great location and name.  Quality has not followed.
data.text: Sure wish the service and quality matched the anticipated enjoyment.  Did not wish to return again.  This is an average meal you would expect at a truck stop along the highway, not in the middle of a tourist town.

data.title: It's been better but very disappointed today!
data.text: I'm not sure what has happened in the last six months ... I use to enjoy the the good food and for the most part friendly and helpful service but today was horrible.  We walked in at 1:45 ... they close at 2:00 and we were quickly informed of that by the host? I jokingly responded ... are you going to kick us out after we order? ... no response.  We were seated and placed our order ... I had a free entree from their rewards program for my Birthday.  I mentioned that and our waitress Kayla said she would log it in ... she came back and said my email address didn't work but she signed me up. I asked if I could try because I knew it worked ... she said she tried and it didn't. So finally after asking 2 more times she let me and it worked fine. The food was good but not special and the place wasn't as clean as normal.  About a half dozen flies were buzzing around landing on us and our food during the whole time and we chose to eat inside. Kayla never once returned to our table to ask if we needed anything and by the way we were out the door by 2:15.  What use to be a favorite breakfast place is not anymore. I don't recommend it anymore and probably won't be back.  Atmosphere and customer service is important to me when I spend money to eat out and it's not an inexpensive place to eat!

data.title: An Arvada locals favorite
data.text: The Egg Shell has been in Arvada longer than I have and I have been here 25 years.  It was always good but within the last year they did a major remodel and upgrade.  They now have a liquor license and my wife and I like a Bloody Mary, Mimosa, or a glass of wine with our Sunday breakfast or brunch

data.title: Delicious food
data.text:
We sat outside in the front of the restaurant & it did get a little noisy with the cars, trucks & motorcycles driving by.  There is also a courtyard in the back, which didn't appear to be open at the time.  
The food was delicious!  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros & my husband ordered the Spanish Omelette.  Both were very tasty.  My husband also ordered a spicy Bloody Mary & that could have been a meal in itself!  It came with a large celery stalk, 2 very large olives, a lemon wedge, & a piece of bacon.  It had just the right amount of spices.  (We like it spicy!)  The only thing that could use some improvement are the potatoes.  They were crispy on one side & not quite so much on the other.  
The service was good.  We went on a Monday mid-morning, so it wasn't too crowded.

data.title: Wonderful time with family enjoying good food!
data.text: My wife and I have been visiting my sister and her husband in the Denver Area. We had visited this eclectic restaurant about two years ago and had a very nice experience. Well, we had our second nice experience. The creative Benedicts are delicious: We had the June Special poached eggs done perfectly over English muffin with grilled turkey, Swiss, and cool avocado slices, all with hollandaise sauce. We topped it off with the Strawberry and chocolate drizzle and chips waffle topped with whipped cream. Delish!!

data.title: Another excellent Sunday brunch
data.text: This place is consistently very good and very economical. The value is very high for the price. The food is well prepared and presented, and the tastes are excellent. Today we had the Belgian Benedict (two eggs and dry bacon on half a waffle with hollandaise), Popeye's Omelette, blueberry blintzes (with fresh blueberries), and Shep's Favorite. We had about a ten minute wait, but the food the came out quickly and hot. We have become regulars.

data.title: Fun Birthday Breakfast
data.text: Very friendly atmosphere and server. When she realized it was my husband's birthday, she brought out a cinnamon roll with a lighted candle! Food is very good with fresh ingredients and more than adequate portions. They serve wonderful LavAzza coffee! When weather permits, there is comfortable outdoor seating both front and back with seasonal flowers! We especially like the quaint brick walkway in back and cozy atmosphere.

data.title: Delicious breakfast
data.text: We have enjoyed the Egg Shell for many years. It truly is an Old Town Arvada institution. The coffee is delicious, everything is fresh and tasty. I always enjoy the Popeye Omelette. It's our go-to many Sunday's!

data.title: Best breakfast in Olde Town Arvada!
data.text:
You're in for a tasty treat here. Their omelets and other choices are scrumptious! The servings are enormous.....we can rarely finish an entree. Great atmosphere, good service, in cute Olde Town 
Arvada!

data.title: Good breakfast, good prices
data.text: Enjoyed the atmosphere in that we could actually carry on a conversation without yelling across the table. The food is very good and the service as well. They nake a tasty omelet.

data.title: Very slow in the morning
data.text:
We planned a work breakfast and were the second table to arrive.  After waiting for 15+ minutes for only our drinks I went looking for our server.  I found her waiting on three other tables that came in after us.  One already had his food and she was bringing out the other one.  
I had to literally track down another person to have them tell our server we would need our ticket when our food came because we were going to be late for our work day.  15 minutes later our food finally came with no check.
Food was okay, but not worth the stress to do it again.

data.title: Very good for family brunches
data.text: Fresh and creative food makes for very good family brunches. We've sat both inside and outside, and we've found the service good in both spots. Easy parking is available just west of the restaurant.

data.title: Decent Breakfast
data.text: I have been here a couple of times to grab breakfast. Their menu has both breakfast and lunch options. All the food I have gotten has always been satisfactory and enjoyable. They just started offering mimosas and bloodies. It is in a nice location and always fills me up! I like sitting out on the patio. The inside area is not that impressive.

data.title: In Need of a Renovation
data.text: The food was ok, but I think I could have done as well or better at home.  When we went, the menus were dirty, the tableware was worn and water spotted.  Clearly used for many years - please replace it with newer, cleaner looking items.  The coffee pot looked like it hadn't been scrubbed for a long, long, time.  Basically, this is a good restaurant that hasn't kept up with the wear and tear of being a popular place to eat breakfast.  Needs a deep cleaning and an investment in table service.

data.title: Fine Place For Breakfast
data.text: I went here for a late breakfast recently. It wasn't crowded then but can be at times. Since it was a hot day I decided to eat inside (but outside seems more popular). I ordered a regular breakfast and it was a large amount. good eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. I love breakfast but I couldn't finish it all. A large meal. The food and the service were both pretty good.
